ngiemboon: Samîɛ la pú ḿbíte yɛ̌ nò shwóŋ púɔ Ésàlayɛ ntsèm.
en: And Samuel’s words came to all Israel.

ngiemboon: Palÿɔ́ʼncù pe Filisi la gʉa ńtyé mvfò pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ lélÿɔ́ʼɔ wɔ́b. Epʉ̀a Filisi la lÿɔ́ʼ pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ tà ńjÿó, pɔ́ la zẅé mbàŋa mmó ntsáʼ lekùɔ pie é la tyé na nkàŋ, á tsɛ̀ɛ nkáʼa ncù.
en: The Philistines lined up in battle formation against Israel, and as the battle intensified, Israel was defeated by the Philistines, who struck down about four thousand men on the battlefield.

ngiemboon: Aláʼ la piŋ nzèm tsɛ̀ɛ jʉʼʉ lepumó, mekěm pa Ésàlayɛ gɔɔn ngie: mélàʼakɔ́ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gÿǒ pʉ̀a Filisi jÿó wégè lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn? Pege gʉa Shʉlo ńkaa kʉbé kʉ̀a ye Cʉ̀apʉ̀a; à tó ńkúu tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege, ńkẅé wégè mbwó megàŋmbù pégè!
en: When the troops returned to the camp, the elders of Israel asked, “Why did the Lord defeat us today before the Philistines?   Let’s bring the ark of the Lord’s covenant from Shiloh. Then it  # 4:3 Or he will go with us and save us from our enemies.”  # 4:3 Nm 10:35; Jos 6:6

ngiemboon: Aláʼ leen ńké ńtúm tsɔ́ nùɔ palÿɔ́ʼncù, pɔ́ gʉa Shʉlo ńkaa kʉbé kʉ̀a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé palÿɔ́ʼncù, á gẅie à néŋe na Mekɛlẅimbeŋ. Ɔbnîi pɔ́ Fineya pie é laa penkʉ́ Elîɛ pembàŋa laa wó, ńgẅiin kʉbé kʉ̀a Ssé.
en: So the people sent men to Shiloh to bring back the ark of the covenant of the Lord of Armies, who is enthroned between the cherubim.   Eli’s two sons, Hophni and Phinehas, were there with the ark of the covenant of God.

ngiemboon: Mé la gwɔ́ tà ńdɔgɔ kʉbé kʉ̀a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ńtó tà ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ jʉʼʉ lepumó, pa Ésàlayɛ ntsèm pú ńkwéʼe ngyè lekág; atsetsáʼ ntsèm pú ńcʉʼʉ.
en: When the ark of the covenant of the Lord entered the camp, all the Israelites raised such a loud shout that the ground shook.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Filisi la júʼ páʼ mé kaga; ńgɔɔn ngie: ngyè lekág kẅɛɛ tsɛ̀ɛ jʉʼʉ lepumó pʉ̀a Ébɛ̀ páʼɔɔn, á gwɔ́ nò kɔ́? Pɔ́ la leen ńké ńzsé ngie mé lɔgɔ́ kʉbé kʉ̀a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ńtó tà ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ jʉʼʉ lepumó.
en: The Philistines heard the sound of the war cry and asked, “What’s this loud shout in the Hebrews’ camp? ” When the Philistines discovered that the ark of the Lord had entered the camp,

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Filisi pú ḿbɔ́g; ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: Ayɛ̂ gie Ssé kwǎʼ ńtó tà ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ jʉʼʉ lepumó lɛ̂! Pege kwě tà ńdem! Akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ áa páʼɔɔn mbà á kubé!
en: they panicked. “A god has entered their camp! ” they said. “Woe to us! Nothing like this has happened before.

ngiemboon: Yě ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ yege lê! Tà wɔ̌ zɔ ge láʼ kẅé wégè mbwó yɛ̂ ntí messé mie é tʉ tɛʼ lɛ̂? Ée messé mie é la néŋ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ mentí mentí twó pʉ̀a Egíbtò, á fʉ̀ʼ gie pɔ́ láa kwòŋotsẅɛ.
en: Woe to us! Who will rescue us from these magnificent gods? These are the gods that slaughtered the Egyptians with all kinds of plagues in the wilderness.

ngiemboon: Pi kẅiʼi ńtʉte, pi gwɔ́ kwàʼ mbàŋa, pi pʉ̀a Filisi, ḿbɔ́gɔ légwɔ́ gie ngwɔ́ pi cʉ́ʼ menkwɔɔn pʉ̀a Ébɛ̀, páʼ pɔ́ la zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ yɔ́b menkwɔɔn pí! Pi gwɔ́ kwaʼ mbàŋa, ńzsé ngie pi ge cwoŋo lÿɔ́ʼ!
en: Show some courage and be men, Philistines!   Otherwise, you’ll serve the Hebrews just as they served you.  # 4:9 Jdg 13:1; 1Sm 14:21 Now be men and fight! ”

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Filisi la leen ńké ńdÿɔ́ʼ ncù, tà ńjÿó pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ. Epʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ kÿo, awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ gʉa né tsɛ̀ɛ wé ntàb. Ntí gie mé la lɔg ńjÿó wɔ́b la pú ńtʉ tɛʼ, palÿɔ́ʼncù pa Ésàlayɛ pie é la ne ńgiŋe pɔ́ ssé, é la kwéte tà ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a ntsáʼ móm ntá.
en: So the Philistines fought, and Israel was defeated,   and each man fled to his tent.  # 4:10 2Sm 18:17; 2Kg 14:12 The slaughter was severe #— #thirty thousand of the Israelite foot soldiers fell.

ngiemboon: Mé la kẅé kʉbé Ssé; Ɔbnîi pɔ́ Fineya pie é laa gubé Elîɛ yembàŋa pú ńkwéte.
en: The ark of God was captured, and Eli’s two sons, Hophni and Phinehas, died.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ mámbàŋa na ngẅɛ̀ Mbɛŋjÿamɛŋ la fó yé tsẅɛɛ ncù ńkÿo tà ńkúu Shʉlo pɔ́ lyɛʼó, menzsǒ mé gwɔ́ me shʉate, atsetsáʼ piŋ ḿbú ńgwɔ́ twó yé, ńdɔgɔ ńnyɛɛ ngie legwé ée na yé.
en: That same day, a Benjaminite man ran   from the battle and came to Shiloh. His clothes were torn,  # 4:12 Jos 7:6; 2Sm 1:2; 15:32; Neh 9:1 and there was dirt on his head.

ngiemboon: À la gwɔ́ kúu tÿǒsoŋ, Elîɛ néŋe na kwɔ̀ʼɔ yé, á ngʉ̀ŋe lǎŋ, ńne ńdíe jʉʼ, mélàʼmie além yé la ne ńtsɔ́ʼɔ, ńtí kʉbé Ssé. Andÿò ŋwɛ́ la tó tà ńkúu tÿǒsoŋ, ńdaʼte mmó gie á ka cʉate, aláʼ pú ńzye légaʼte lê tʉ̀.
en: When he arrived, there was Eli sitting on his chair beside the road waiting,   because he was anxious about the ark of God. When the man entered the city to give a report, the entire city cried out.

ngiemboon: Elîɛ la júʼ páʼ aláʼ ne ńgaʼte púʼu, ńzɛ́te ngie: Ejʉʼ pége pegé ńtí kɔ́? Mámbàŋa wa leen ńkÿote ńtó éshwóŋo Elîɛ nò ŋwɛ́ Elîɛ.
en: Eli heard the outcry and asked, “Why this commotion? ” The man quickly came and reported to Eli.

ngiemboon: Á la gwaa gwɔ́, Elîɛ gẅiin ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b lefɔ̌ɔn né móm lepfwɔʼɔ́, à te gíŋe ńkuʼu légyá jʉʼ wɔ́.
en: At that time Eli was ninety-eight years old, and his eyes didn’t move   because he couldn’t see.  # 4:15 1Kg 14:4

ngiemboon: Mámbàŋa ŋwɛ́ gɔɔn né Elîɛ ngie: Mèŋ fóo páʼɔɔn né ncù; n ně fó nkáʼa ncù ńkÿo lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn. Elîɛ zɛ́te yé ngie: Míŋ wɔ̀ɔn, akɔ́ zɔ̌ ně ḿbiŋ ńgÿo?
en: The man said to Eli, “I’m the one who came from the battle.   I fled from there today.”

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à la lɔg wɛ̌ nkʉ̀ ńtó tsɔ́ʼ ngie: Pa Ésàlayɛ ka fó mvfò pʉ̀a Filisi ńkÿo, mé piŋ ḿbú ńzẅéte pʉ̀a pég tɛʼ; tà mbɔɔ penkʉ́ pú pembàŋa mépʉ́a, Ɔbnîi pɔ́ Fineya ka pú ńkwéte; mé gwɔ́ mege cÿɔb, ńgíŋe ńkẅé kʉbé Ssé!
en: The messenger answered, “Israel has fled from the Philistines, and also there was a great slaughter among the people. Your two sons, Hophni and Phinehas, are both dead, and the ark of God has been captured.”

ngiemboon: À la leen ńkíme nò kʉbé Ssé, Elîɛ fó na kwɔʼɔ yé ńgwe nzèmenzème, á gwɔ́ púʼu ńgwɔ́ ngʉ̀ŋe ncú tÿǒsoŋ; à la pwɔ́ʼɔ mìi lóŋ yé, ńkwé; mélàʼmie à laa nzẅìŋe nyìŋ, ḿbiŋ ńcʉ́e tɛʼ. À laa Ésàlayɛ ńgwɔ́ sàʼntsaŋ na ngùʼ móm lekùɔ.
en: When he mentioned the ark of God, Eli fell backward off the chair by the city gate,   and since he was old and heavy, his neck broke and he died. Eli had judged Israel forty years.

ngiemboon: Anzwě míŋ we, á nzwě Fineya la gwaa gwɔ́, ńgwɔ́ shwoŋ tà ńcʉ́ʼʉ ńgee pɔ́ ńzyé. Á la gwɔ́ tà ńjúʼ ngie mé la kẅé kʉbé Ssé, tà mbɔɔ páʼ tá ndúm we pɔ́ ndúm we la pú ńkwéte, á leen ḿvege ńtsɔ́gte ssé ńzyé, mélàʼmie à la pú ne ńdúme tɛʼ.
en: Eli’s daughter-in-law, the wife of Phinehas, was pregnant and about to give birth. When she heard the news about the capture of God’s ark and the deaths of her father-in-law and her husband, she collapsed and gave birth because her labor pains came on her.

ngiemboon: Páʼ à la ne ńgee ńkwé la, epʉ̀a pie é la tyéte lejʉ́ŋ yé gɔɔn né yé ngie: Te pɔ́g, ɔ̀ zyě tàʼ múɔ mbàŋa! Táʼ, à te tsɔ́b, à la te ne ńkwoŋo léjúʼu tsɔ́ nò wɔ́.
en: As she was dying,   the women taking care of her said, “Don’t be afraid. You’ve given birth to a son! ”  # 4:20 Gn 35:16–19 But she did not respond or pay attention.

ngiemboon: À la tóŋ lezíŋ múɔ mbàŋa ŋwɛ́ lê Ekavɔd, ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie «legúʼ aa nzɔ̌?» Ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: Legúʼ ka fó Ésàlayɛ ńgʉa! À lɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn púʼu ńtí páʼ mé la kẅé kʉbé Ssé, ḿbiŋ ńgíŋe ńtíi páʼ tá ndúm we pɔ́ ndúm we la pú ńkwéte.
en: She named the boy Ichabod,   saying, “The glory has departed from Israel,”  # 4:21 Ps 26:8; Jr 2:11 referring to the capture of the ark of God  # 4:21 1Sm 4:11 and to the deaths of her father-in-law and her husband.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn ngie: Legúʼ kéen fó Ésàlayɛ ńgʉa mélàʼmie mé ka kẅé kʉbé Ssé!
en: “The glory has departed from Israel,” she said, “because the ark of God has been captured.”
